TrainingDetailsVTwo.Name: Title
TrainingDetailsVTwo.Title: Title Element
TrainingDetailsVTwo.Abstract: All about the title of a page or component.
TrainingDetailsVTwo.BodyCopy:
The title element is a required field on all pages and components and is the name by which they are known. The title is one of the most important parts of a page. It should describe the page or component as uniquely, and concisely as possible. Search engines value the title highly. A poor title will make any page or component harder to find in searches, and less enticing to readers.

Proper Use

While the title field will allow a few special characters, please avoid all except alpha-numeric characters and hyphens.

Keep in mind that the Title field is also used for the page title in the browser window, bookmarks of the page, and search engine results.

The Title is typically displayed on the page, in the browser's window and bookmarks, and on other pages that reference or use content from the page. For example, the title of a News Article is show at the top of the article, and on the News Index and News Archive pages that reference it. The Index and Archive pages use the Title to link the reader back to the full article.

Titles deserve careful thought. They represent this page at a glance.

How to write a good title.

See also (Text Field)

Please Note

The Title is not the same as a "page name" (the name you see in the site tree in Web Builder). The page name is only used internally, and to construct the URL.
